strategy: Addition of polynomial features using interaction terms.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures, StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
for col in X_train_encoded.columns:
    if col not in test_data_encoded.columns:
        test_data_encoded[col] = 0

# Impute missing values
X_train_encoded.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data_encoded.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Create polynomial features
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, interaction_only=True)
X_train_poly = poly.fit_transform(X_train_encoded)
test_data_poly = poly.transform(test_data_encoded)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_poly)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data_poly)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures, StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(X_train_encoded.columns) - set(test_data_encoded.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data_encoded[c] = 0

# Impute missing values
X_train_encoded.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data_encoded.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Create polynomial features
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, interaction_only=True)
X_train_poly = poly.fit_transform(X_train_encoded)
test_data_poly = poly.transform(test_data_encoded)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_poly)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data_poly)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures, StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(X_train_encoded.columns) - set(test_data_encoded.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data_encoded[c] = 0

# Impute missing values
X_train_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)
test_data_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)

# Create polynomial features

test_data_poly = poly.transform(test_data_encoded)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(X_train_encoded.columns) - set(test_data_encoded.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data_encoded[c] = 0

# Fill missing values with 0
X_train_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)
test_data_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_data_encoded)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(X_train_encoded.columns) - set(test_data_encoded.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data_encoded[c] = 0

# Fill missing values with 0
X_train_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)
test_data_encoded.fillna(0, inplace=True)

# Convert to DMatrix for XGBoost
dtrain = xgb.DMatrix(X_train_encoded, label=y_train)
dtest = xgb.DMatrix(test_data_encoded)

# Set parameters
params = {
    'objective': 'reg:squarederror',
    'eval_metric': 'rmse'
}

# Train model
num_rounds = 100
bst = xgb.train(params, dtrain, num_rounds)

# Predict
predictions = bst.predict(dtest)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_data.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Separate features and target

y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Encode categorical variables

test_data_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_data)
